issue.title: Support proxy option for `serve s3 <remote>` similar to `--auth-proxy`

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`



#### What is your current rclone version (output from `rclone version`)?



#### What problem are you are trying to solve?
**Scenario:**
An org has a WebDAV server where most of the files/folders are stored and they have s3 clients. The s3 clients want to access the files from that webdav server.
So I want to serve webdav backend with `serve s3` command. Allow multiple s3 clients to access webdav server via rclone's `serve s3` server.

Use case:
1. add a WebDAV backend without `user` and `password` in rclone
2. serve with `rclone serve s3 <remote> --proxy-mode`
3. Multiple s3 clients send requests to acces the files that are stored in that webdav server

![rclone_s3_proxy](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/assets/52366632/981b2007-25f5-4fc7-a802-509f75609f7e)

#### How do you think rclone should be changed to solve that?

I tried to implement `--auth-proxy` but that works only with `user:pass`. Since the S3 client sends signed `Authorization` header, it is not possible to parse `user:pass` from the request by `serve s3`.

So, the one way is to work with oauth token. The s3 client uses oauth token as the accessKey (doesn't care about the secretKey).
`serve s3` will then parses the oauth key from the request, creates new vfs and authorize that vfs with oauth token (Bearer token) per request.

Changes required:
1. method `setBearerToken` should be made public
https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/8f0e9f9f6bd78f6ac7488ac48bbe7e9a9ba418ab/backend/webdav/webdav.go#L521
2. `--proxy-mode` option for `serve s3` so that the default would be off.
3. Parse oauth token from each s3 client request and create new vfs for the request context
4. Requires gofakes3 Backend methods to receive request object:
    ```go
    ListBuckets(r *http.Request) ([]BucketInfo, error)
    ```

POC PRs in https://github.com/rclone/rclone/pull/7646, https://github.com/Mikubill/gofakes3/pull/3

#### How to use GitHub

* Please use the üëç [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are affected by the same issue.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.

body:
I'm pretty sure this is a bug in our fork of rclone/gofakes3 

I think that the code unconditionally uses URL encoding. It writes this in the output though.

```
  <EncodingType>url</EncodingType>
```

Whereas the code should look at the `content-encoding` to turn it on or off.

Can you create a matching issue here https://github.com/rclone/gofakes3/issues (link to this issue) and then I'll see if we can find someone to fix it - or maybe you'd like to have a go?

issue.title: Wrong encoding type in ListBucketResult - should not be url-encoded

repository.name: gofakes3
repository.description: A simple fake AWS S3 object storage

issue.body:
The library returns the value inside `<Key>` (= filenames) as a URL-encoded string, even when no `content-encoding=url` has been specified in the request. Moreover, no `<EncodingType>` node is ever present in the `<ListBucketResult>`.

The official PHP SDK fails to deal with this situation and ends up using url-encoded strings as simple UTF-8 strings which obviously fails later on.

The original issue on rclone is here: https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/7836

body:
> I think that the code unconditionally uses URL encoding. [...]
> Whereas the code should look at the content-encoding to turn it on or off.

Well, this is how I understand the code too, but it's not what's happening. The `<ListBucketResult>` never has the `<EncodingType>` node. You can easily check that using a basic GET with `curl host:8080/SomeBucket | grep EncodingType`

> Can you create a matching issue here

Sure. I didn't see there was a specific subproject.
There it is: https://github.com/rclone/gofakes3/issues/4

> or maybe you'd like to have a go?

Unfortunately I don't speak Go. :frowning_face:

Thanks for making the other issue- we need both I think. 

I captured this from an actual http transaction from rclone serve s3
      <EncodingType>url</EncodingType>

So rclone does send it sometimes.

Can you capture the http request that is being generated, maybe using wireshark?

I wonder if it isn't working for v1 listings as I did a V2 listing.

I'm currently giving up on the Azuracast/rclone/S3 solution as it has unfortunately too many flaws and I'm not sure it will be stable enough in the long term.

> I wonder if it isn't working for v1 listings as I did a V2 listing.

You're right sorry, my curl command was making a V1 request. When using `?list-type=2` to switch to V2, the node seems to always be present in the response.

However it seems that the proper way to work is to encode the keys only if the client asked for it with `?content-encoding=url`. This is the part I'm not exactly sure I understand and I also opened a PR for what I think is also a bug in the SDK : https://github.com/aws/aws-sdk-php/pull/2918

Would the issue reported above account for this error I am receiving when I try to build?:
```
go build -v --ldflags "-s -X github.com/rclone/rclone/fs.Version=v1.67.0"  
cmd/serve/s3/backend.go:14:2: cannot find module providing package github.com/rclone/gofakes3: import lookup disabled by -mod=vendor
```
If so, is there a solution I can implement, or wait for a fix in the next version of rclone?
I found the issue.  .gitignore had an entry "rclone" , so the vendor/github.com/rclone folder was not being included in my local commit.  I am surprised no one else ran into this.

Any news on this? I use Nextcloud's ‚ÄúExternal Storage‚Äù feature to mount a rclone backend that is exposed via rclone serve s3. This works wonderfully except for the problem that files containing spaces cannot be opened. This is due to the incorrect URL encoding, as spaces become a ‚Äú+‚Äù.

I've had a go at fixing this.

Please give this a try - thanks!

[v1.69.0-beta.8469.5eca44305.fix-s3-serve-encoding](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-s3-serve-encoding/v1.69.0-beta.8469.5eca44305.fix-s3-serve-encoding/) on branch [fix-s3-serve-encoding](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-s3-serve-encoding) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

@ncw Is this contained in the current beta tag of the rclone docker image? I created a custom image since i'm using rclone-serve (https://github.com/jonohill/docker-rclone-serve) to serve the files via s3 and to be able to test. But the problem furthermore exists.
@PatrickHuetter the fix is only on the branch I indicated above - it hasn't made it to the beta yet.
Okay, would you merge it for beta state? I checked the code and it seems to be the fix we need :) Afterwards i would directly test everything!

@ncw I tested the fix. It works! But there is another problem with encoding: Files which contain german characters like a-umlaut "√§" don't work. So now most of the files work but all files for example who are named "Rechnungen M√§rz 2024.pdf" which is "invoices of march 2024.pdf" in english, don't work.
